definition: ox/cattle/scalper of tickets etc/to fail to show up/to break a promise
ox/cow/bull/CL:條|条[tiao2],頭|头[tou2]/newton (abbr. for 牛頓|牛顿[niu2 dun4])/(slang) awesome
"shopping coupon scalper", sb who sells unwanted or returned shopping coupons to others for a profit

sentences.english: This will be the workhorse of China's lunar programme.
sentences.chinese: 這是中國登月項目中的“老黃牛”。

sentences.english: Water buffaloes are stronger, and can swim.
sentences.chinese: 水牛比黃牛好，力氣大，還會游泳。

sentences.english: We can try to buy some tickets outside the stadium from a scalper.
sentences.chinese: 我們可以試着在體育場外買黃牛票。

sentences.english: But this did not block the scalpers pour road of the goods.
sentences.chinese: 但這並未阻斷“黃牛”的倒貨之路。

sentences.english: He bought the ticket at a high price from a (ticket) scalper.
sentences.chinese: 他從一個票販子手裏高價買了張黃牛票。

sentences.english: Scalpers pour goods, be not is a special case of the electric business online.
sentences.chinese: “黃牛”倒貨，並非是線上電商的特例。

sentences.english: As I went in , there was a scalper selling tickets for 5$.
sentences.chinese: 當我們進去的時候，有黃牛在賣票，才5美元一張。

sentences.english: Don't forget to take Xinhuang dry scalper beef home.
sentences.chinese: 新晃黃牛肉一定要帶點回來。

sentences.english: The results were compared with those of bovine chymotrypsin.
sentences.chinese: 並與黃牛糜蛋白酶進行了比較。

sentences.english: But scalpers said that weekend prices are higher and holiday-time prices will go through the roof.
sentences.chinese: 可是黃牛說週末價錢更高，假期票價將會高入雲霄。

sentences.english: He's planning to go to Germany anyway and try for scalped tickets.
sentences.chinese: 他計劃無論如何也要到德國去，並且努力買到黃牛票。

sentences.english: That is the word today, scalper, and wedding banquet scalper, and ticket scalper.
sentences.chinese: 我們今天說的就是黃牛黨這個詞，scalper。

sentences.english: A cow grazes on a paddy of rich three-month-old rice.
sentences.chinese: 一頭黃牛在一塊種植了三個月的肥沃稻田裏喫草。

sentences.english: A lot of train tickets are bought by scalpers.
sentences.chinese: 黃牛掌握了大量的火車票源。

sentences.english: Gradually, tradition changed to make a depictional ox suffient for this purpose.
sentences.chinese: 逐漸的演變成一種風俗習慣在河邊用黃牛鎮水。

sentences.english: But apparently a lot of those tickets are falling into the hands of scalpers.
sentences.chinese: 但是顯然這些票中有很大一部分落到了黃牛黨手中。

definition: to buy tickets/(Tw) to buy votes (in an election)
group buying/collective buying/buying by a group of individuals who negotiate a discount for the group
to join in the fun/to get in on the action/(fig.) to butt in/to create more trouble
to set up a vendor's stall in the street
to appreciate (in value)/to increase in price
to watch a play/to watch passively (i.e. from the sidelines, from the crowd)
inner area (of a place that has an outer area)/the kitchen of a restaurant (as opposed to the dining area)/infield (baseball etc)/(Chinese opera) the area behind the table on the stage
